When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.

 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over ti

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even

You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years.

You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few y

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. T

 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expres

 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She

 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.

 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her a

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation

One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation.

You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children.

 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to starte

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years.

 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. S

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children.

 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need t

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years.

You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a gl

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at yo

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing

 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwin

One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children.

She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligibl

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children.

She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible

 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words w

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She

 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. S

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams in

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children.

 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway friend

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train.

One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children.

She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins teari

You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. S

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years.

You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite size

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chuks

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chunks of your fles

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chunks of your flesh into her mouth an

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chunks of your flesh into her mouth and swallows. She takes your blood into her mouth and drinks it. She

You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chunks of your flesh into her mouth and swallows. She takes your blood into her mouth and drinks it. She is consuming you

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them.

She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chunks of your flesh into her mouth and swallows. She takes your blood into her mouth and drinks it. She is consuming you.

She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chunks of your flesh into her mouth and swallows. She takes your blood into her mouth and drinks it. She is consuming you. There is so

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chunks of your flesh into her mouth and swallows. She takes your blood into her mouth and drinks it. She is consuming you. You are t

You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
 You have witnessed the changes in her, over time. She was a very warm and caring person earlier in her life, but as she reached middle age she began to change. She became cold and distant. She would get lost in some internal thought, and it would be almost impossible to get her attention. 
You know that the drug is the cause of this.
 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chunks of your flesh into her mouth and swallows. She takes your blood into her mouth and drinks it. She is consuming you. You are terrified beyo

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years.

 You want to help her, but you've never even taken the drug and have no idea what she is feeling. After a few years, she begins to scare you. There is a cold emptiness in her eyes, and she no longer expresses any affection for anyone, even her own children. 
One day, you're sitting at home, and she comes in.
 She says nothing, she only stares. You try to greet her and make idle conversation. She continues to stare at you in silence. You ask her if she's ok. She suddenly breaks into a rage, like you've never seen before. She screams at you, telling you that you're a monster, that you're a horrible person, that you're a terrible father, and that you need to die. She picks up a glass and throws it at you. She begins tearing up the room, throwing everything in her path toward your aging body. She screams unintelligible, unformed words toward you. She turns bright red. She charges toward you. You can't move. She slams into you like a runaway freight train. 

Once you're on the floor, she begins tearing at your flesh. She takes bite sized chunks of your flesh into her mouth and swallows. She takes your blood into her mouth and drinks it. She is consuming you. You are terrified beyond belief. Th

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the “Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered.

It turns out that people, over the years, have experienced sharper than normal degradation to their mental processes. People who have been taking the drug continue to look young, but they degrade mentally and emotionally. It gets really pronounced after about 50 years. 
You're a member of the Lost Generations.
 You have experienced normal degradation, but the people around you, who all appear young, are very different form you. They are cold, unfeeling, and distant. You hardly go outside anymore, in your golden years. You can't stand to be around them. 
You have a daughter, who is a member of the Young Generations.
